articles.author: Yimou Lee, Bernard Orr
articles.description: Taiwan's military mobilised its forces and said it was confident it could protect the island, after China started two days of "punishment" drills around Taiwan on Thursday in what it said was a response to "separatist acts".
articles.title: Taiwan mobilises forces after China starts 'punishment' drills

articles.author: Greg Torode, Laurie Chen
articles.description: In launching two days of punishment drills to protest against what it sees as the separatist instincts of Taiwan's newly inaugurated President Lai Ching-te, Beijing is sending a finely calibrated warning.
articles.title: With mock attacks, China sends honed warning to Taiwan's new president

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces killed 35 Palestinians in aerial and ground bombardments across the Gaza Strip on Thursday and battled in close combat with Hamas-led militants in areas of the southern city of Rafah, health officials and Hamas media said.
articles.title: Israeli forces kill dozens of Palestinians as they push deeper in Gaza's north and south

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Donald Trump has posted on social media that he will use his relationship with Russian President Vladimir Putin to get Wall Street reporter Evan Gershkovich freed from a Russian prison.
articles.title: Trump says Putin will free jailed U.S. reporter Gershkovich for him

articles.author: William James, Kate Holton
articles.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and his Labour Party rival Keir Starmer kicked off their election campaigns on Thursday, each arguing that only they can snap the country out of its economic and political malaise.
articles.title: Rishi Sunak and Keir Starmer hit campaign trail as UK election race begins

articles.author: Kirsty Needham, Camille Raynaud
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron landed in the Pacific island of New Caledonia on Thursday, for a day of talks during which he will aim to turn the page on deadly riots triggered by a contested electoral reform.
articles.title: Macron arrives in riot-hit New Caledonia for high-stakes talks

articles.author: Aaron Ross
articles.description: The deployment of the first Kenyan police officers to Haiti to lead an international anti-gang force has been delayed after a planned flight from Nairobi was postponed on Tuesday, two sources briefed on the matter told Reuters.
articles.title: Deployment of first Kenyan police to Haiti delayed, sources say

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden and Kenyan President William Ruto will announce on Thursday investments in green energy and health manufacturing in the east African nation and a plan to reduce its debt burden, a senior U.S. administration official said.
articles.title: Biden and Kenya's Ruto to announce new investments as they seek deeper ties

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian attack on Ukraine's northeastern city of Kharkiv killed two people and injured at least seven, local authorities said on Thursday.
articles.title: Russian attack on Ukraine's Kharkiv kills two, injures at least seven, governor says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Polish parliamentary commission will inform prosecutors that the former prime minister's role in an abortive plan to organise elections by postal vote during the COVID pandemic may constitute a crime, its deputy chairman said on Thursday.
articles.title: Polish ex-PM's role in pandemic election may be crime, lawmaker says
